entries.journal_entry_description: Learning to fight now will save your life later.
entries.task00_journal_entry_description: While out of combat, press ESC to clear your target and  press the button for 'Bacta Shot.' The icon looks like a syringe. While in combat, Bacta Shot heals the target if the target is a player character, or heals whomever the enemy is attacking.  So, there is no need to retarget to heal the person taking damage if you are engaged with an enemy.
entries.task00_message_box_text: While out of combat, press ESC to clear your target and  press the button for 'Bacta Shot.' The icon looks like a syringe. While in combat, Bacta Shot heals the target if the target is a player character, or heals whomever the enemy is attacking.  So, there is no need to retarget to heal the person taking damage if you are engaged with an enemy.
entries.task01_journal_entry_description: Now that you understand how healing works, talk to Trehla Keelo.
entries.task02_journal_entry_description: Go out to Junktown to kill 10 Tusken Zealots.
entries.task03_journal_entry_description: To choose an appropriate enemy, first look at the name. If the name is yellow, the NPC may be attacked, but will not attack first. Red names indicate that an enemy is hostile and will attack first if given the opportunity. Humanoids (and creatures) with white names are not attackable. Blue names indicate other players.    Next, look at the mark next to the name. Green means the target is easily defeated. Blue means the fight will be challenging. White means the target has equivalent skills to you and the fight will be a close one. If the mark is blue or white, the enemy is an equal level or less. If the mark is yellow, fighting this creature will be a dangerous proposition. If the mark is red or purple, the enemy is too dangerous to attack on your own right now.
entries.task03_message_box_text: To choose an appropriate enemy, first look at the name. If the name is yellow, the NPC may be attacked, but will not attack first. Red names indicate that an enemy is hostile and will attack first if given the opportunity. Humanoids (and creatures) with white names are not attackable. Blue names indicate other players.    Next, look at the mark next to the name. Green means the target is easily defeated. Blue means the fight will be challenging. White means the target has equivalent skills to you and the fight will be a close one. If the mark is blue or white, the enemy is an equal level or less. If the mark is yellow, fighting this creature will be a dangerous proposition. If the mark is red or purple, the enemy is too dangerous to attack on your own right now.
entries.task04_journal_entry_description: Left-click to target a specific enemy or press Tab to cycle through enemies, beginning with the nearest one.  To attack, press the 'Ranged Shot' button (the bulls-eye icon) if you have a blaster equipped.  If you have a melee weapon equipped, press the 'Melee Hit' button (the hand grasping a sword.)  To change a single attack into a continual attack, press CTRL while clicking on the icon.  A check box appears over the icon, indicating that the ability will be continually used as long as there is a valid target for it.
entries.task04_message_box_text: Left-click to target a specific enemy or press Tab to cycle through enemies, beginning with the nearest one.  To attack, press the 'Ranged Shot' button (the bulls-eye icon) if you have a blaster equipped.  If you have a melee weapon equipped, press the 'Melee Hit' button (the hand grasping a sword.)  To change a single attack into a continual attack, press CTRL while clicking on the icon.  A check box appears over the icon, indicating that the ability will be continually used as long as there is a valid target for it.
entries.task05_journal_entry_description: Each profession has special abilities.  These special abilities deplete the Action (green) and/or Mind (blue) bar.  Examples of special moves include:  TAUNT: Incite the target to attack you. MELEE STRIKE: Do more damage than the standard melee attack. BACTA SHOT: Heal self or ally. KNOCKDOWN RECOVERY:  Stand up after being knocked down.
entries.task05_message_box_text: Each profession has special abilities.  These special abilities deplete the Action (green) and/or Mind (blue) bar.  Examples of special moves include:  TAUNT: Incite the target to attack you. MELEE STRIKE: Do more damage than the standard melee attack. BACTA SHOT: Heal self or ally. KNOCKDOWN RECOVERY:  Stand up after being knocked down.
entries.task06_journal_entry_description: Choose a weapon that you want to use and go to Junktown to kill 10 Tusken Zealots.  Left-click to target a specific enemy or press Tab to cycle through enemies, beginning with the nearest one.  To attack, press the 'Ranged Shot' button (the bulls-eye icon) if you have a blaster equipped.  If you have a melee weapon equipped, press the 'Melee Hit' button (the hand grasping a sword.)  To change a single attack into an auto-attack, press CTRL while clicking on the icon.  A check box appears over the icon, indicating that the ability will be continually used as long as there is a valid target for it.
entries.task07_journal_entry_description: You killed the Tusken Zealots.  Return to Trehla and let her know.
entries.task08_journal_entry_description: Go out of Mos Eisley to harvest Dwarf Nunas
entries.task08_journal_entry_title: Leave Mos Eisley to Harvest Dwarf Nunas
entries.task09_journal_entry_description: Once you kill a creature, right-click on its corpse and choose 'Harvest Resources' and then the item to harvest.  In most cases, the choices are: Bone, Hide, and Meat.  These resources may be used to craft items.
entries.task09_message_box_text: Once you kill a creature, right-click on its corpse and choose 'Harvest Resources' and then the item to harvest.  In most cases, the choices are: Bone, Hide, and Meat.  These resources may be used to craft items.
entries.task10_journal_entry_description: Hunt and kill 10 dwarf nunas and harvest their meat, bone, or hide.  To harvest a creature, right-click on its corpse and choose 'Harvest Resources' and then the item to harvest.  In most cases, the choices are: Bone, Hide, and Meat.  These resources may be used to craft items.
entries.task11_journal_entry_description: Bring back your bounty to Trehla Keelo in Mos Eisley.
